meanings.definition: Abnormality in the shape or size of a body part
meanings.sent1: The doctor diagnosed the patient with a dysmorphic condition in his hand.
meanings.sent2: The dysmorphic feature of her face was due to a genetic disorder.
meanings.sent3: Despite his dysmorphic toe, he could still run fast.
meanings.sent4: The tree's dysmorphic branch twisted in an unusual way.
meanings.sent5: The dysmorphic shape of the rock made it stand out from the others.

meanings.definition: Distorted perception of one's own appearance
meanings.sent1: Her dysmorphic view of herself led to low self-esteem.
meanings.sent2: The psychologist helped her overcome her dysmorphic thoughts.
meanings.sent3: His dysmorphic mirror made him look taller than he actually was.
meanings.sent4: The funhouse mirror created a dysmorphic reflection of her face.
meanings.sent5: The dysmorphic filter on the camera made everyone look funny.

meanings.sent1: The dysmorphic flower in the garden caught everyone's attention.
meanings.sent2: The dysmorphic structure of the building made it unstable.
meanings.sent3: The dysmorphic toy had a unique charm to it.
meanings.sent4: Her dysmorphic artwork challenged traditional beauty standards.
meanings.sent5: The dysmorphic clouds in the sky resembled strange creatures.
